medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The girl was initially screened at birth and was inconspicuous. Symptoms of severe congenital hypothyroidism presented at 4 months of age, characterized by low free T3 (fT3) and undetectable free T4 (fT4) levels. Following treatment with T4 substitution, fT3 and fT4 levels normalized rapidly.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Congenital central hypothyroidism due to TSH mutation
medical_history.family_history: Several affected family members show presence of TSH/H9252313/H9004T mutation.
